workhead.title: The Tears of Fancie, or Love Disdained

head.title: Sonnet 20.My hart accused mine eies and was offended
head.firstline: My hart accused mine eies and was offended

poem.body: My hart accused mine eies and was offended, Vowing the cause was in mine eies aspiring: Mine eies affirmed my hart might well amend it, If he at first had banisht loves desiring. Hart said that love did enter at the eies, And from the eies descended to the hart: Eies said that in the hart did sparkes arise, Which kindled flame that wrought the inward smart, Hart said eies tears might soone have quencht that fl[ame,] Eies said harts sighs at first might love exile: So hart the eies and eies the hart did blame, Whilst both did pine while both the paine did feele. Hart sighed and bled, eies wept and gaz'd too much, Yet must I gaze because I see none such.
